metadata.title: CVE-2021-3739 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the btrfs_rm_device functionin fs/btrfs/volumes.c in the Linux Kernel, where triggering the bugrequires ‘CAP_SYS_ADMIN’. This flaw allows a local attacker to crash thesystem or leak kernel internal information. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to system availability.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
